title: Meet the 6 women innovators featured in a new STEM exhibit at Seattle’s Pacific Science Center
description: Six orange statues on display at the Pacific Science Center in Seattle offer an eye-catching way to learn about the contributions of women in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM). And they stand as a reminder that seeing examples of role models can help break down the barriers standing in the way of future successful girls and women. Short for “If she can she it, then she can be it,” the IF/THEN display is part of the broader “Science for Everyone” exhibit at the Science Center. Through interactive screens, video interviews and the 3D-printed statues, visitors can learn from STEM… Read More
